context: The Finnish word 'kuiva' means 'dry'. It is an adjective that describes something lacking moisture. The word can also be used as a verb meaning to dry something.  It declines based on case, with forms like 'kuivan' (genitive singular) and 'kuivat' (nominative plural). There are many possessive forms as well, such as 'kuivani' (my dry), 'kuivasi' (your dry), etc. The word has a wide range of uses, from describing weather to the state of objects.
